unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand the application and interpretation of several advanced statistical methods applicable to research in psychology.
Know how abstract concepts are operationalised in statistical terms in psychological research.
Gain an enhanced practical understanding of statistical software use in psychological research, with a focus on understanding the syntax required to carry out analyses and interpreting output.

Calculate sample size requirements: a) Prospectively, by estimating sample size needed for simple research designs b) Retrospectively, by calculating statistical power available at the end of a study for simple research designs.

enrolment_rules.description: PSYH490 or PSHY4490 or PSYH495 or PSYH4495 or PSYH4491 or PSYH4492

assessments.description: Final examination held in scheduled class time, in accordance with relevant requirements.
The Research Proposal Form is designed to help you with the process of planning your empirical project. No word limit required.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is designed as preparation for honours projects and to help equip students for research careers. The unit focuses on practical issues of quantitative data analysis. Most topics are dealt with in the context of Stata. Topics include sample size and statistical power analysis, data management in Stata and more advanced methods specifically applicable to research in psychology.
data.title: Design and Statistics IV

title: Design and Statistics IV
